page.title: 17Recreation in Knockholt
page.content: This area is used for recreation by many people besides the residents. The footpaths are used regularly by families and walking clubs from London who often lunch in the pub gardens. People come here for country drives, cycle rides and on horses, and in Winter to ski and sledge. Several fields are used for keeping horses and there are private paddocks, tennis courts and swimming pools. Pheasant shoots take place on the Chevening Estate and there are occasional clay pigeon shoots. Gardening is one of the chief leisure activies of the locals who also join in the life of adjacent villages; Old Peoples Clubs, Brownies, W.I., clubs for art, flower arranging, horticulture and drama; sports like football and cricket and social clubs. Dog walkers, joggers and pony traps are often seen.
